children.subject: You can apply, but an offer is unlikely given the high number of applicants who have already taken the course before. A common pathway to course staff is typically by becoming an Academic Intern or joining Computer Science Mentors (applications open near the end of the semester)!

We are unlikely to consider students who are currently taking the the class. If you are interested in helping with the class next semester, please apply to be an academic intern (that application will be released towards the end of the semester)
Can we apply if we are in the class this semester?

Make sure you fill out the universal application first (I believe the priority deadline passed but you can still submit an application).

Once you've done so, individual classes will typically send out supplemental applications. I remember last semester they were consolidated in a thread, but I don't think one was made for Spring 2022 yet. 

For AIs, applications typically don't open until around week 2-3 of the semester, so I would just keep an eye on this Piazza for when the apps open!

Edit: Apps will open for AI applications in December!
thanks a lot! By week 2-3 of the semester, you mean the semester I want to be an AI for a particular class?
Yup!

ty! I am a sophomore and have never been on the course staff yet. Would you recommend applying for an AI or reader for cs 61a/b, eecs 16a rather than applying for a UGSI (as I do not have any prior teaching experience)?

also, can I be an AI for 61b for sp22 if I am taking the class this semester?

thanks in advance

This is purely personal experience (so anyone else can feel free to chime in here), but I was an AI for three semesters before I joined CSM, then course staff for 61B. I felt like these positions allowed for me to gradually develop my teaching style over time. With that being said, I would recommend applying for a reader/tutor position (I know of some members on course staff who started teaching as a reader/tutor without prior teaching experience) over a UGSI position at the moment so you can gain some more experience.

You can absolutely be an AI for 61b for spring 2022 if you're taking the class right now! In fact, many of our AIs this semester took the class in spring/summer 2021!

Feel free to reach out through email if you'd like to chat about course staff (especially if you're considering 61b!)

The information above is incorrect, the AI application will be released towards the end of this semester (in December) and will likely be due the week before Spring classes start. We will blast all the old piazzas / eds so you don't miss it, but by week 2-3 all the AIs are already selected and helping in labs

do you know what's the procedure of applying to other CS courses, like CS 61A (I am currently taking 61b)?

also, to be an academic intern when is the deadline of application?

thanks in advance
Interesting question. I am not running the program next semester but I would lean towards saying yes. Be sure to ask when the intern app comes out later this semester
Can we apply as an academic intern (not paid position!) if we've taken a class that articulates to this at a community college?
Realistically it is very unlikely we will consider hiring current students. We have other avenues (academic interning) that are more suited for someone who has just taken the class
<md>If we have teaching experience for other courses and outside, but we're still taking 61B this semester, is it worth applying? Will you consider current progress in the class? Thank you!</md>
Yes
Would I still be considered meeting the priority deadline if I submitted the form 3 minutes later than the exact deadline(10/15 11:59pm)?
Soon, probably the next week or so
Do you have a (rough) estimate on when we might hear back after submitting apps? I want to make sure I don't miss an email or anything hehe :) Thanks
Hi, I did the TA interview last week and I am wondering when will the decision be made? Thank you : )

history.content:
Hello! If you are interested in joining course staff for CS61B in the Spring semester, this is the post for you!

 

Here is everything you need to know / fill out:

  • Department Hiring Application - If you have not done so already, please fill this application out by October 15th if you would like to apply to be on course staff in the Spring. We will not look at this application, but its completion is required by the department. That means you can feel free to leave any essay sections blank and you to not need to attach a resume etc. All you need to do is mark 61B and submit the form like this:

  • Supplemental Hiring Application - The 61B supplemental hiring application is available here. Unlike the department application, it is important that you put thought and effort into all your responses here. This is the application we will be using to decide if we want to interview you as a potential applicant. It is due October 15th, but we will take applications on a rolling basis thereafter.

history.subject: Join CS61B Course Staff for Spring 2022!

history.content:

Here is everything you need to know / fill out:

  • Department Hiring Application - If you have not done so already, please fill this application out by October 15th if you would like to apply to be on course staff in the Spring. We will not look at this application, but its completion is required by the department. That means you can feel free to leave any essay sections blank and you to not need to attach a resume etc. All you need to do is mark 61B and submit the form like this:

  • Supplemental Hiring Application - The 61B supplemental hiring application is available here. Unlike the department application, it is important that you put thought and effort into all your responses here. This is the application we will be using to decide if we want to interview you as a potential applicant. It is due October 15th, but we will take applications on a rolling basis thereafter.

  • Continuing with the Course Meeting - If you have any additional questions or want to just talk about what it is like the be on course staff, I will being holding a meeting where I go over the hiring process and take questions this Tuesday, October 12th from 7:30 - 8:30pm in Soda 306 (HP Auditorium). If you are interested please come with questions.

#pin
